title: The Transfiguration
subtitle: When the veil of flesh opens and glory breaks through

key_verse.text: And was transfigured before them: and his face did shine as the sun, and his raiment was white as the light.

cards.title: The Mount of Glory
cards.subtitle: Six days later: the prophetic context
cards.content:
Matthew 17:1 begins: 'After six days...'

üîç SIX DAYS AFTER WHAT?

Matthew 16:21-28 records:
‚Ä¢ Jesus predicts His death and resurrection (v.21)
‚Ä¢ Peter rebukes Him (v.22)
‚Ä¢ Jesus rebukes Peter: 'Get thee behind me, Satan' (v.23)
‚Ä¢ Jesus speaks of the cost of discipleship (v.24-26)
‚Ä¢ Jesus promises: 'There be some standing here, which shall NOT TASTE OF DEATH, till they see the Son of man coming in his kingdom' (v.28)

‚ö° THE PROMISE FULFILLED:

SIX DAYS later, Jesus fulfills that promise. Peter, James, and John SEE the Son of Man in His glory - a preview of His kingdom.

‚õ∞Ô∏è THE MOUNT (likely Mount Hermon):

‚Ä¢ Height: 9,232 feet - the highest mountain in Israel
‚Ä¢ Covered with snow at its summit ('white as the light')
‚Ä¢ Remote location, far from crowds
‚Ä¢ Border between Israel and the gentile world

üìñ THE BIBLICAL PATTERN:

God reveals Himself on mountains:
‚Ä¢ Moses receives the Law on Sinai
‚Ä¢ Elijah hears the still small voice on Horeb
‚Ä¢ Jesus gives the Sermon on the Mount
‚Ä¢ Jesus prays on the Mount of Olives
‚Ä¢ Jesus dies on Golgotha (mount)
‚Ä¢ Jesus ascends from the Mount of Olives

Mountains are places of divine encounter, where heaven touches earth.
cards.revelation_key: Right when the disciples hear of the cross (death), Jesus shows them the crown (glory). The transfiguration is the divine antidote to discouragement.

cards.title: Metamorpho≈ç: Transformed from the Inside Out
cards.subtitle: Not a disguise, but a revelation

greek_words.meaning: To transform, transfigure, change form revealing internal essence
greek_words.revelation:
This Greek verb gives us the English word 'metamorphosis'. It means:

‚Ä¢ Transformation from the INSIDE out
‚Ä¢ Not putting on a costume; revealing what's already within
‚Ä¢ Like a caterpillar transforming into a butterfly - the butterfly was already in the caterpillar's DNA

Jesus didn't 'dress up' as glorious. He let His INTERNAL glory shine through His humanity.

For 33 years, Jesus had VEILED His glory. In the transfiguration, for a few moments, the veil opens and the disciples see who He REALLY is.

üî• THE SAME WORD IN ROMANS 12:2:

'Be ye transformed (metamorpho≈ç) by the renewing of your mind.'

The same transformation that happened to Jesus on the mount must happen in you! Not external, but internal. Not religious, but real.
greek_words.application: Your Christian transformation isn't putting on a religious mask. It's letting Christ's glory in you shine through your life.

greek_words.revelation:
The verb describes an ACTIVE, RADIANT, IMPOSSIBLE-TO-HIDE brightness.

'His face did shine AS THE SUN' - not a soft glow, but the brightest light source known to man.

Remember:
‚Ä¢ In creation, God said 'Let there be light' (Genesis 1:3)
‚Ä¢ Jesus says 'I am the light of the world' (John 8:12)
‚Ä¢ In the transfiguration, that LIGHT becomes physically visible

It's the same glory (Shekinah) that:
‚Ä¢ Filled the tabernacle (Exodus 40:34)
‚Ä¢ Filled Solomon's temple (1 Kings 8:11)
‚Ä¢ Now dwells in Jesus's body ('the Word was made flesh, and DWELT among us, and we beheld his GLORY' - John 1:14)
greek_words.application: The glory you see in the transfiguration isn't new. It's the eternal glory of the Son that for a moment became visible. This is the glory He had with the Father before the foundation of the world.

cards.revelation_key: The transfiguration wasn't Jesus receiving glory. It was Jesus revealing the glory He always had but had veiled in His humanity.

cards.title: Moses and Elijah: The Law and the Prophets
cards.subtitle: Two witnesses of two covenants
cards.content:
Matthew 17:3 says: 'And, behold, there appeared unto them Moses and Elias talking with him.'

üîç WHY MOSES AND ELIJAH?

üìú MOSES represents the LAW:
‚Ä¢ Received the Ten Commandments on Sinai
‚Ä¢ Gave the Torah to Israel
‚Ä¢ Prophesied the Messiah: 'The LORD thy God will raise up unto thee a Prophet like unto me' (Deuteronomy 18:15)
‚Ä¢ Died and was buried by God Himself (Deuteronomy 34:5-6)

üî• ELIJAH represents the PROPHETS:
‚Ä¢ The greatest OT prophet
‚Ä¢ Never died - was taken to heaven in a chariot of fire (2 Kings 2:11)
‚Ä¢ Prophesied to return before the Messiah (Malachi 4:5)

‚ú® TOGETHER they represent:
‚Ä¢ 'The Law and the Prophets' - the entire Old Testament
‚Ä¢ Both had encounters with God on mountains (Sinai/Horeb)
‚Ä¢ Both fasted 40 days
‚Ä¢ Both represent the old covenant

üí¨ WHAT WERE THEY DISCUSSING?

Luke 9:31 reveals: 'They spake of his decease (EXODUS in Greek), which he should accomplish at Jerusalem.'

They were talking about the CROSS!

‚Ä¢ Moses led the first Exodus (departure from Egypt)
‚Ä¢ Jesus would accomplish the FINAL Exodus (departure from sin and death)
‚Ä¢ The Law and the Prophets POINT to the cross

üéØ THE MESSAGE:

The entire Old Testament (Law and Prophets) is fulfilled in Jesus. They DON'T compete with Jesus; they TESTIFY of Jesus.

scripture_connections.text: And beginning at Moses and all the prophets, he expounded unto them in all the scriptures the things concerning himself
For had ye believed Moses, ye would have believed me: for he wrote of me

cards.revelation_key: The Old Testament isn't a different book from the gospel. It's the gospel in shadows, pointing toward Christ.

cards.title: The Father's Voice: This Is My Beloved Son
cards.subtitle: The second time the Father speaks from heaven
cards.content:
Matthew 17:5: 'A bright cloud overshadowed them: and behold a voice out of the cloud, which said, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased; hear ye him.'

‚òÅÔ∏è THE CLOUD:

‚Ä¢ Not an ordinary cloud - 'bright cloud' (luminous cloud)
‚Ä¢ The SHEKINAH - the visible glory of God
‚Ä¢ The same cloud that:
  - Led Israel in the wilderness (Exodus 13:21)
  - Filled the tabernacle (Exodus 40:34-35)
  - Filled the temple (1 Kings 8:10-11)
  - Will carry Jesus in the ascension (Acts 1:9)
  - Will bring Jesus in His second coming (Matthew 24:30)

üó£Ô∏è THE FATHER'S VOICE (second time in the gospels):

1Ô∏è‚É£ FIRST TIME - At baptism (Matthew 3:17):
‚Ä¢ 'This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased'
‚Ä¢ At the BEGINNING of Jesus's ministry

2Ô∏è‚É£ SECOND TIME - At transfiguration (Matthew 17:5):
‚Ä¢ 'This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased; HEAR YE HIM'
‚Ä¢ Just BEFORE the cross
‚Ä¢ With a CRUCIAL addition: 'HEAR YE HIM'

üì¢ 'HEAR YE HIM!':

Peter had just suggested making three tabernacles (v.4) - putting Jesus on the same level as Moses and Elijah.

The Father CORRECTS this:
‚Ä¢ Not three tabernacles - ONE only
‚Ä¢ Not three voices - ONE voice
‚Ä¢ Not 'listen to the Law AND the Prophets AND Jesus'
‚Ä¢ But: 'HEAR YE HIM' - Jesus is SUPERIOR

üîä HEBREWS 1:1-2 confirms:

'God, who at sundry times and in divers manners spake in time past unto the fathers by the prophets, Hath in these last days spoken unto us by his Son.'

Moses and Elijah were spokesmen for God. Jesus IS the Word of God.

scripture_anchor.text: For he received from God the Father honour and glory, when there came such a voice to him from the excellent glory, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased. And this voice which came from heaven we heard, when we were with him in the holy mount.

cards.revelation_key: The Law and the Prophets were good, but Christ is FINAL. Don't add anything to Jesus. He is sufficient, complete, supreme.

discovery_questions.question: Jesus veiled His glory in human flesh out of love for you. Do you appreciate that the King of the universe made Himself vulnerable to save you?
The same word 'metamorpho≈ç' describes Jesus's transfiguration and your transformation in Romans 12:2. Are you allowing Christ to shine FROM WITHIN you, or just trying to look religious externally?
The Father says 'HEAR YE HIM.' Are you listening to Jesus's voice above all other voices, even religious voices?

prayer.title: Prayer of Worship
prayer.content: Glorious Jesus, transfigured King. Thank You that on the mount You revealed who You REALLY are - the Son of God in radiant glory. For 33 years You veiled Your glory to come close to me. On the cross, Your glory was hidden even more to bear my sin. In the resurrection, Your glory shone again. And one day, when I see You face to face, I'll see that glory unveiled for all eternity. Father, thank You for the voice from heaven: 'This is my beloved Son.' Today I choose to HEAR HIM alone. Holy Spirit, transform me from within. Let Your glory shine through my broken life. Metamorphose me until I reflect Christ's image. In the name of the beloved Son, Amen.
